Package com.hedera.hashgraph.identity.hcs.did

Class HcsDidMessage

java.lang.Object
com.hedera.hashgraph.identity.hcs.Message
com.hedera.hashgraph.identity.hcs.did.HcsDidMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class HcsDidMessage
extends Message
The DID document message submitted to appnet's DID Topic.

  • Field Details

    • operation

      @Expose(serialize=true, deserialize=true) protected DidMethodOperation operation

    • did

      @Expose(serialize=true, deserialize=true) protected java.lang.String did

    • didDocumentBase64

      @Expose(serialize=true, deserialize=true) protected java.lang.String didDocumentBase64

    • created

      @Expose(serialize=false, deserialize=false) protected org.threeten.bp.Instant created
      The date when the DID was created and published. It is equal to consensus timestamp of the first creation message. This property is set by the listener and injected into the DID document upon calling getDidDocument() method.

    • updated

      @Expose(serialize=false, deserialize=false) protected org.threeten.bp.Instant updated
      The date when the DID was updated and published. It is equal to consensus timestamp of the last valid update or delete message. This property is set by the listener and injected into the DID document upon calling getDidDocument() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • HcsDidMessage

      protected HcsDidMessage​(DidMethodOperation operation, java.lang.String did, java.lang.String didDocumentBase64)
      Creates a new instance of HcsDidMessage.
      Parameters:
      operation - The operation on DID document.
      did - The DID string.
      didDocumentBase64 - The Base64-encoded DID document.

  • Method Details

    • fromDidDocumentJson

      public static MessageEnvelope<HcsDidMessage> fromDidDocumentJson​(java.lang.String didDocumentJson, DidMethodOperation operation)
      Creates a new DID message for submission to HCS topic.
      Parameters:
      didDocumentJson - DID document as JSON string.
      operation - The operation on DID document.
      Returns:
      The HCS message wrapped in an envelope for the given DID document and method operation.

    • getEncrypter

      public static java.util.function.UnaryOperator<HcsDidMessage> getEncrypter​(java.util.function.UnaryOperator<byte[]> encryptionFunction)
      Provides an encryption operator that converts an HcsDidMessage into encrypted one.
      Parameters:
      encryptionFunction - The encryption function to use for encryption of single attributes.
      Returns:
      The encryption operator instance.

    • getDecrypter

      Provides a decryption function that converts HcsDidMessage in encrypted for into a plain form.
      Parameters:
      decryptionFunction - The decryption function to use for decryption of single attributes.
      Returns:
      The Decryption function for the HcsDidMessage

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Validates this DID message by checking its completeness, signature and DID document.
      Returns:
      True if the message is valid, false otherwise.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(@Nullable com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.TopicId didTopicId)
      Validates this DID message by checking its completeness, signature and DID document.
      Parameters:
      didTopicId - The DID topic ID against which the message is validated.
      Returns:
      True if the message is valid, false otherwise.

    • extractDidRootKey

      public com.hedera.hashgraph.sdk.PublicKey extractDidRootKey()
      Extracts #did-root-key from the DID document.
      Returns:
      Public key of the DID subject.

    • getDidDocument

      public java.lang.String getDidDocument()
      Decodes didDocumentBase64 field and returns its content. In case this message is in encrypted mode, it will return encrypted content, so getPlainDidDocument method should be used instead. If message consensus timestamps for creation and update are provided they will be injected into the result document upon decoding.
      Returns:
      The decoded DID document as JSON string.
